snippet: The pope is also scheduled to address Congress in Washington and hold a Mass at Madison Square Garden when he visits the United States in September.
abstract: Vatican releases itinerary for Pope Francis' first visit to United States; reveals pope will visit homeless center in Washington, school in East Harlem and prison in Philadelphia; will also address Congress, raising prospect that he may weigh in on issues facing US, like prison reform, consequences of capitalism and the environment.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kate Pastor, Jon Hurdle, Nicholas Fandos and Elisabetta Povoledo.

lead_paragraph: The pope is also scheduled to address Congress in Washington and hold a Mass at Madison Square Garden when he visits the United States in September.

headline.print_headline: Pope to Address the Humble and the Powerful Alike in a Three-City U.S. Visit
headline.main: Pope to Address the Humble and the Powerful Alike in a Three-City U.S. Visit
